column4: m0rtimer: Well the kernel itself is perfectly fine and all the files seem to be in order (at least the diagnostics say so) but I still can't get the GUI up and running...  Is there a way I can reconstruct Linux on my system without total format?
Anyone?  I really don't feel like formatting my HDD AGAIN....
does your system crash immediately after installing during first boot to new os?
It crashes some time after it's already up and running.  I think it may have something to do with the graphics card.  Or the fact it's a 64-bit system.
64bit shouldn't be the prob.. what graphics?
ATI Radeon.
have you installed the restricted ati driver from restricted drivers manager? no probs there? you're on 9.04?
I did via the hardware manager thing that came packaged with Ubuntu.
Yeah.  From what (all the exhaustive) diagnostics tell me is that there is nothing wrong with the Ubuntu installation...
Now before each crash, there is one thing in common: I'm trying to get my blasted touchpad working.

i can't be of more help, but i think it'd be good to start with graphics. maybe turn of restricted driver and see if you get same result? try running from livecd and see if that crashes. try turning off desktop effects before you try the other things.
oh, that's probly good info
so touchpad doesn't work out of the box?
No.  Now I've found ways of modifying xorg.conf but whenever I even touch the file, it's like pandora's box.
i've always enjoyed how well touchpads work out of the box on ubuntu with all features working. maybe you should try google for your laptop model as well as ubuntuforums
and divulge that info here for further possible help
Tried that...  I open Xorg.conf via Gedit, don't change a thing, save it, and the next thing I know, my GUI fries.
do an 'lspci' to see what ubuntu says your touchpad is, might help you track down info
It says it's a "PS/2 Mouse"
huh
laptop model?
weird that you wouldn't see 'synaptics' or 'alps' touchpad device..
Toshiba Sattelite P305D
